title: Netflix thriller Fractured leaves confused viewers shaken
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

**Spoilers ahead**

Seems filmgoers are pretty shaken up by Netflix’s latest thriller, Fractured.

The film, starring Sam Worthington, was only recently launched on the streaming service, but social media is alight with punters who were left on the edge of their seat by the tale.

Seemingly taking inspiration from Jodie Foster’s Flightplan, Worthington plays Ray, a father trying to learn the truth about his family after they mysteriously vanish while his daughter is receiving treatment at a hospital.

Of course just seeing the trailer alone you know something mysterious is afoot, as Ray’s mental state continues to become more and more unravelled as the frustrated man seeks answers.

Advertisement

Soon the viewer wonders whether he is making his family up this whole time.

Where is Ray’s family? (Picture: NETFLIX)

Turns out there’s a pretty stellar plot twist, because not all is at it seems (der), which has got the masses talking.

Fans were loving the twist, as one wrote on Twitter: ‘Sam Worthington did a great job in his movie “FRACTURED” 2019 movie of netflix.

‘After watching it, seems like I’ll end up in a mental hospital with him. This is what you called “REAL TWIST” everything in the scene is unpredictable. Great Job, NETFLIX.’

Another was just really ruddy confused as they chimed into the feed: ‘Halfway through Fractured on Netflix, and what the hell is going on?’

Here’s hoping they now have closure.

They weren’t the only one taking to Twitter halfway through the film, though, as another fan wanted their thoughts known.

‘I’m watching #fractured on Netflix and I have absolutely NO IDEA what is happening… on the edge of my seat atm! If it’s good enough to tweet about it before you even finish it, you KNOW you gotta check it out!’

In the film Avatar star Worthington’s character is joined by his wife Joanne (Lily Rabe) and daughter Peri (Lucy Capri) as they travel back from a Thanksgiving weekend with his in-laws which was, for lack of a better word, tense.

Peri is then rushed to the hospital after she falls and injures herself, with Ray being left in the waiting room as his wife accompanies the young girl to a scan.

Advertisement

Advertisement

He passes out while waiting and when he comes to the hospital has no record of the family’s arrival, or of Peri’s scan.

Is there a sinister plot afoot within the hospital? Did his family exist? Is Ray going around the twist?

Some have branded it similar to Shutter Island, read into that what you will.

Just in time for Halloween and some Netflix and Chills, right?

Fractured is on Netflix now.
